work: Traffic was fine, but the parking lot became a battlefield.
My alarm worked — I just didn’t.
The lift stopped at every floor like it was collecting Pokémons.
Someone scheduled the morning too early.
I was on a call… with destiny (she didn’t pick up).
The cab driver insisted he knew a shortcut — now we both know he didn’t.
I was stuck behind someone arguing with the security guard about ID cards.
The biometric scanner didn’t recognize my face — apparently, sleep-deprived me is a stranger.
Rain decided to test my patience and my shoes at the same time.
My smartwatch said I needed more rest — I believed it.
college: The bus driver was explaining philosophy mid-route.
I was helping a first-year find their classroom labyrinth.
The canteen samosa line tested my loyalty to education.
I reached on time, just the wrong building.
Someone told me attendance doesn’t matter — I took it personally.
I was completing an urgent group project — alone.
The cycle chain broke in slow motion.
A street dog decided to escort me halfway here.
The metro door closed like it was avoiding commitment.
The clock and I have trust issues.
friends: Google Maps said 10 minutes — it lied like an ex.
I was leaving on time, but my mom unlocked a side quest.
My phone died heroically trying to wake me up.
I left on time but my stomach had other plans.
Every red light turned philosopher today.
My Uber driver was narrating his life story — couldn’t skip intro.
Met my neighbor on the way — he turned small talk into a full podcast.
My shoelace pulled a dramatic stunt at the gate.
I was halfway when my brain said ‘wallet?’ — instant flashback mission.
I looked in the mirror and had to hype myself up for five minutes.
relationship: She said ‘I need space,’ so I gave her the whole solar system.
We had chemistry, but the lab exploded.
He said ‘it’s not you, it’s me’ — and for once, I agreed.
I didn’t get ghosted — I got deleted from the server.
We were like Wi-Fi — strong connection, terrible stability.
Love is blind, but apparently it can still leave you on read.
I thought we had a spark — turns out it was just short-circuit.
Our relationship was like my phone battery — always dying.
She said she wanted something real, so I sent her electricity bill.
He texted ‘wyd’ and I realized I was wasting my degree.
life: I’m not lazy, I’m on power-saving mode.
I didn’t lose control — I just took the scenic route to failure.
My plans didn’t fall apart; they performed a modern art piece.
I’m not procrastinating — I’m giving future me a character arc.
Everything happens for a reason. Usually a stupid one.
I don’t make mistakes, I create side quests.
My life is just one long buffering screen.
I was gonna change my life today, but the vibes said no.
I didn’t mess up — I added plot twist for dramatic effect.
I didn’t fail — I just unlocked the ‘experience’ achievement.
